Documentation.AWS Documentation: A comprehensive resource for AWS product guides, developer guides, and API references.

Project Management.AWS CodeStar: Enables you to quickly develop, build, and deploy applications on AWS.

Frontend.Amazon S3: Offers secure, durable, and highly-scalable object storage. Commonly used for hosting static websites.
Frontend.AWS Amplify: A set of tools and services for building scalable mobile and web applications.

Backend.AWS Lambda: Lets you run code without provisioning or managing servers.
Backend.Amazon EC2: Provides scalable computing capacity in the AWS cloud.

Database.Amazon RDS: Makes it easy to set up, operate, and scale a relational database in the cloud.
Database.Amazon DynamoDB: A fast and flexible NoSQL database service.

Content.Amazon S3: Used for storing and retrieving any amount of data at any time.
Content.Amazon CloudFront: A fast content delivery network (CDN) service.

Testing.AWS Device Farm: An app testing service for testing and interacting with your Android, iOS, and web apps.

Server.Amazon EC2: Provides resizable compute capacity in the cloud.
Server.AWS Elastic Beanstalk: An easy-to-use service for deploying and scaling web applications.

Deployment.AWS CodeDeploy: Automates code deployments to any instance.
Deployment.AWS CodePipeline: A continuous integration and continuous delivery service.

Maintenance.AWS Systems Manager: Provides visibility and control of your infrastructure on AWS.

Security.Amazon Cognito: Provides user identity and data synchronization.
Security.AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM): Enables you to manage access to AWS services and resources securely.

Automation.AWS CloudFormation: Provides a common language for you to describe and provision all the infrastructure resources in your cloud environment.
Automation.Amazon CloudWatch: Monitors your AWS resources and the applications you run on AWS in real-time.

Marketing.Amazon Pinpoint: Targets your messages to the right audience for your marketing and engagement campaigns.
Marketing.Amazon SES: A cost-effective, flexible, and scalable email service that enables developers to send mail from within any application.

Backup.AWS Backup: A centralized backup service that makes it easy to configure and audit the AWS resources.

API.Amazon API Gateway: Allows developers to create, publish, maintain, monitor, and secure APIs at any scale.

Apps.AWS AppSync: An enterprise-level, fully managed GraphQL service with real-time data synchronization and offline programming features.

Service Provider Company.AWS Partner Network: A global partner program, focused on helping partners build successful AWS-based businesses or solutions.

Individual Service Provider.AWS Certified Professionals: Individuals who have demonstrated their skills and proficiency with AWS technology through various certification exams.

Certifications.AWS Certification: A series of technical certifications offered by AWS for professionals working in cloud computing.

AI.Amazon SageMaker: Enables developers and data scientists to quickly build, train, and deploy machine learning models at scale.
AI.AWS DeepLens: A deep learning-enabled video camera for developers.

Storage.Amazon S3: Scalable storage in the AWS Cloud.
Storage.Amazon Elastic Block Store (EBS): Provides block-level storage volumes for use with EC2 instances.

Operating System.Amazon Linux: A Linux server distribution from Amazon Web Services.

Devices.AWS Snowball: A petabyte-scale data transport solution that uses secure devices to transfer large amounts of data into and out of the AWS cloud.
Devices.Amazon Echo for AWS IoT: A voice-controlled smart speaker that connects to the Alexa Voice Service to play music, make calls, set alarms and timers, ask questions, control smart home devices, and more.

Domain.Amazon EC2: Provides scalable computing capacity in the AWS cloud.
Domain.Amazon S3: Offers secure, durable, and highly-scalable object storage. Commonly used for hosting static websites.
Domain.Amazon RDS: Makes it easy to set up, operate, and scale a relational database in the cloud.
Domain.Amazon DynamoDB: A fast and flexible NoSQL database service.
Domain.Amazon Route 53: A scalable and highly available Domain Name System (DNS) web service.
Domain.AWS Lambda: Lets you run code without provisioning or managing servers.
Domain.Amazon Elastic Beanstalk: An easy-to-use service for deploying and scaling web applications.

Performance.Amazon CloudFront: A content delivery network (CDN) service for fast and secure content delivery.
Performance.Amazon Elasticache: In-memory caching service to improve the performance of web applications.
Performance.AWS Auto Scaling: Automatically adjusts the capacity of your AWS resources to maintain application availability.
Performance.Amazon Elastic Load Balancing: Distributes incoming application traffic across multiple targets.

Communication.Amazon Connect: A cloud-based contact center service for customer engagement.
Communication.Amazon Chime: A communication service for online meetings, video conferencing, and team collaboration.
Communication.Amazon Simple Email Service (SES): A cost-effective email service for sending and receiving email.
Communication.Amazon Pinpoint: Targeted messaging service for personalized customer engagement.
Communication.Amazon SNS: Pub/sub messaging service for building event-driven systems.
Communication.Amazon SQS: Managed message queuing service for decoupling application components.

Requirement Analysis.AWS Glue: Fully managed ETL service for data transformation and preparation.
Requirement Analysis.Amazon QuickSight: Business intelligence service for creating visualizations and dashboards.
Requirement Analysis.AWS Data Pipeline: Orchestration service for moving data between different AWS services.
Requirement Analysis.AWS Step Functions: Serverless orchestration service for building workflows.

Customer Service.Amazon Connect: A cloud-based contact center service for customer engagement.
Customer Service.Amazon Simple Email Service (SES): A cost-effective email service for sending and receiving email.
Customer Service.AWS Support: Technical support and assistance from AWS experts.
Customer Service.AWS Trusted Advisor: Automated best practice checks and recommendations for optimizing AWS resources.

Customer Engagement.Amazon Personalize: Machine learning service for personalized recommendations.
Customer Engagement.Amazon Pinpoint: Targeted messaging service for personalized customer engagement.
Customer Engagement.Amazon Polly: Text-to-speech service for adding lifelike voice to applications.
Customer Engagement.Amazon Lex: Conversational AI service for building chatbots and natural language understanding.
Customer Engagement.AWS Chatbot: Integrates AWS services with chat platforms for operations and security automation.
